item.title: Mattresses and furniture dumped, 14th October
item.description:
Two mattresses and large amount furniture dumped by recycling point on Townshend Road NW8. Blocking pavement, please arrange collection.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Townshend Road, St. John's Wood, Hampstead, City of Westminster

item.title: Light shining into windows oppoaite side of road after recent change, 14th October
item.description:

item.title: Dangerous crossing, 14th October
item.description:
I've just seen a small child nearly get hit by a driver while crossing the road her. It's a popular crossing point for families going to Bellenden, Rye Oak and other local schools and it desperately needs a zebra crossing before something terrible happens.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Peckham Rye, Peckham, London

item.title: Increasingly large pothole on junction of Anerley Road and Anerley Station Road, 14th October
item.description:
There is an increasingly large pothole on the junction of Anerley Road and Anerley Station Road, in the middle of the lane where vehicles turn to enter Anerley Road. The pothole resembles a trough and is probably around 2 feet in length - it has definitely been increasing in size over recent months and could cause damage to cyclists and vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
